content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-162-13-B
|Item_parent=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Item_parent_short=Sexually transmitted infections (STI): gonococcal, chlamydial, syphilis, human papillomavirus (HPV), trichomoniasis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the causes of upper genital infections in women
|Description=None
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=13}}
Venereal origin :

- Gonococcus

- Chlamydia

- Trichomoniasis

Mycoplasma genitalium

Non-venereal origin: streptococcus, staphylococcus, enterococci, enterobacteria, etc.

question.title: What is the primary cause of upper genital infections in women?

option_a.title: Gonococcus
option_a.description: A type of bacteria that causes gonorrhea

option_b.title: Chlamydia
option_b.description: A type of bacteria that causes chlamydia

option_c.title: Trichomoniasis
option_c.description: A type of parasitic infection that causes trichomoniasis

option_d.title: Streptococcus
option_d.description: A type of bacteria that can cause various infections, including strep throat
